Description: Pottery bowl in local colour-coated ware; wheel-made; bowl with sloping sides and sharply incurving rim, narrowing to small ring base; made of buff clay with a red-brown slip, the dark brown colour extending over the interior and the rim with a red colour unevenly placed over the lower part of the exterior; slip is scratched and worn in places.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: Similar shaped bowls in local colour-coated wares have been found at Paphos (Hayes 1991, 158 and Fig 57), at Kition-Bamboula (Salles 1993, Fig. 219, nos 393-395) and also at Salamis (but in Red Glazed Ware) in the dromos of Ayios Seryios Tomb 1 (Karageorghis 1978, pl. XLIX). Bibliography Hayes, J.W. 1991. Paphos. Vol. III. The Hellenistic and Roman Pottery, Nicosia. Karageorghis, V. 1978, Salamis Vol. 7: Excavations in the Necropolis of Salamis IV, Nicosia. Salles, J.-F. 1993. Kition-Bamboula IV. Les Niveaux hellénistiques, Paris
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
